Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204 - 6992.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Emergency restraint
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160
Section The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/3/2024, a youth was upset that a staff had their MP3 player,
and they couldn't get it back because they were not following
program so the youth started to grab and hit on the staff's vehicle
trying to damage it. The youth was placed in a standing restraint
until they calmed down.
Investigation
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Youth A described being outside when she
was not supposed to so Supervisor took Youth A’s MP3 player.
Youth A reported Youth B came outside saying things to Youth A,
so Youth A went after Youth B to fight Youth B. Youth A stated
she was placed in a restraint by Supervisor for trying to fight Youth
B. Youth A denied being restrained by Staff 1. Youth A was
asked about trying to damage Supervisor’s truck and possibly
being restrained for those actions. Youth A denied damaging
Supervisor’s truck but stated the restraint happened outside in the
parking lot by Supervisor’s truck. Youth A was asked again if she
had ever been restrained by Staff 1. Youth A denied Staff 1 ever
restrained her.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Youth B described last week getting into a
verbal argument with Youth A but denied either one of them was
placed in a restraint. Youth B reported she could not recall what
day the argument occurred or what staff intervened. Youth B
stated she could not recall what the argument was over, but it was
“probably something stupid Youth A said.” Youth B stated she
was unaware of any restraint with Youth A, Staff 1 and/or
Supervisor. Youth B denied having any knowledge of Youth A’s
MP3 player being taken away by Supervisor.
2

Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Youth C reported she was not aware of
Youth A damaging any staff’s vehicle or Youth A’s MP3 player
being taken away by a staff. Youth C stated Youth A was placed
in a restraint for trying to fight Youth B. Youth C reported she
could not recall when the restraint occurred or what staff were
involved in the restraint. Youth C described the restraint occurring
in the evening hours in the second parking lot by the facility.
Youth C denied having any concerns with the restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
November 18, 2024. Staff 1 described Youth A being upset at
Supervisor for Supervisor taking Youth A’s MP3 player. Staff 1
stated Supervisor was in his truck leaving the facility when Youth
A ran to Supervisor’s truck. Staff 1 reported Supervisor stopped
the truck and Youth A started to run around the truck, punching
the windows, jumping in and out of the bed of the truck and
threatening Supervisor. Staff 1 described standing in front of
Youth A trying to get Youth A to calm down and walk away. Staff
1 stated Youth A was punching the driver’s side window, and he
was afraid she was going to break the glass and cut her hand, so
he placed Youth A in a restraint. Staff 1 reported he placed Youth
A in a low standing restraint and moved Youth A away from
Supervisor’s truck. Staff 1 stated the immediate safety concern
was Youth A breaking the driver side window of Supervisor’s truck
and cutting her hand. Staff 1 reported he did not believe there
were any other youth in the area when the restraint occurred.
Staff 1 stated Supervisor was the only other staff present during
the restraint.
Case Manager was interviewed via telephone on November
20, 2024. Case Manager stated she was not working the day
Youth A was placed in a restraint. Case Manager reported Youth
A told Case Manager that Youth A’s MP3 player was taken away
for not following programing. Case Manager denied Youth A
saying anything about being in a restraint with Staff 1.
Supervisor was interviewed via telephone on December 3,
2024. Supervisor stated he could not recall Youth A being
restrained by Staff 1. Supervisor reported other youth were
restrained that night, but he did not remember Youth A being in a
restraint. Supervisor denied having any concerns with Staff 1.
Video Reviewed:
There was no video footage available as the restraint occurred off
camera.
3

Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Staff 1 completed the required Crisis Prevention
Intervention training on 10/14/2024.
• Incident Report 199580241 for Youth A. Incident report
documents, Youth A was grabbing and hitting Supervisor’s
vehicle trying to damage it so Staff 1 placed Youth A in a
restraint.
• Behavior Support and Management Policy: Policy
documents restrictive intervention is used when a youths’
behavior would result in physical injury or imminent risk of
physical harm of the client, other client, staff members, or
others.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per Staff 1’s interview, Staff
1 restrained Youth A for punching the glass windows of
Supervisor’s vehicle and being concerned Youth A was going to
break the glass and cut herself. Youth A described being
restrained for attempting to fight another youth.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was offered to help newer staff write clearer,
more detailed incident reports to describe the severely aggressive
behavior that places the youth or others at serious threat of
violence or injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Health status assessment; notification; debriefing; reporting
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163
Section (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
Description by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A's incident report was not completed within the required
timeframe.
4

Investigation When reviewing documentation of Youth A’s restraint, the incident
report was submitted five days after the incident occurred. The
restraint occurred on 11/03/2024 and the report was submitted on
11/08/2024 still in draft pending approval.
Documents Reviewed:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 199580241 for Youth A: Date of incident
11/03/2024, incident report submitted date 11/08/2024.
Analysis The facility is in noncompliance of the rule for submitting Youth A’s
incident report five days after the restraint occurred and still
having the report pending approval.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C0000529 dated 09/20/2023; CAP approved 10/26/2023
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
